speaker: Porter
text_entry: SCENE V. The palace.

speaker: Porter
text_entry: Enter trumpets, sounding; then two Aldermen, Lord  Mayor, Garter, CRANMER, NORFOLK with his marshal's  staff, SUFFOLK, two Noblemen bearing great  standing-bowls for the christening-gifts; then  four Noblemen bearing a canopy, under which the  Duchess of Norfolk, godmother, bearing the child  richly habited in a mantle,  and c., train borne by a  Lady; then follows the Marchioness Dorset, the  other godmother, and Ladies. The troop pass once about the stage, and Garter speaks

speaker: Garter
text_entry: Heaven, from thy endless goodness, send prosperous

speaker: Garter
text_entry: life, long, and ever happy, to the high and mighty

speaker: Garter
text_entry: princess of England, Elizabeth!

speaker: Garter
text_entry: Flourish. Enter KING HENRY VIII and Guard

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: [Kneeling] And to your royal grace, and the good queen,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: My noble partners, and myself, thus pray:

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: All comfort, joy, in this most gracious lady,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Heaven ever laid up to make parents happy,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: May hourly fall upon ye!

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Thank you, good lord archbishop:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: What is her name?

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Elizabeth.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Stand up, lord.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: KING HENRY VIII kisses the child

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: With this kiss take my blessing: God protect thee!

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Into whose hand I give thy life.

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Amen.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: My noble gossips, ye have been too prodigal:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I thank ye heartily; so shall this lady,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: When she has so much English.

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Let me speak, sir,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: For heaven now bids me; and the words I utter

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Let none think flattery, for they'll find 'em truth.

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: This royal infant--heaven still move about her!--

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Though in her cradle, yet now promises

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Upon this land a thousand thousand blessings,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Which time shall bring to ripeness: she shall be--

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: But few now living can behold that goodness--

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: A pattern to all princes living with her,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: And all that shall succeed: Saba was never

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: More covetous of wisdom and fair virtue

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Than this pure soul shall be: all princely graces,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: That mould up such a mighty piece as this is,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: With all the virtues that attend the good,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Shall still be doubled on her: truth shall nurse her,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Holy and heavenly thoughts still counsel her:

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: She shall be loved and fear'd: her own shall bless her;

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Her foes shake like a field of beaten corn,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: And hang their heads with sorrow: good grows with her:

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: In her days every man shall eat in safety,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Under his own vine, what he plants; and sing

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: The merry songs of peace to all his neighbours:

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: God shall be truly known; and those about her

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: From her shall read the perfect ways of honour,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: And by those claim their greatness, not by blood.

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Nor shall this peace sleep with her: but as when

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: The bird of wonder dies, the maiden phoenix,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Her ashes new create another heir,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: As great in admiration as herself;

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: So shall she leave her blessedness to one,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: When heaven shall call her from this cloud of darkness,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Who from the sacred ashes of her honour

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Shall star-like rise, as great in fame as she was,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: And so stand fix'd: peace, plenty, love, truth, terror,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: That were the servants to this chosen infant,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Shall then be his, and like a vine grow to him:

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Wherever the bright sun of heaven shall shine,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: His honour and the greatness of his name

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Shall be, and make new nations: he shall flourish,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: And, like a mountain cedar, reach his branches

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: To all the plains about him: our children's children

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Shall see this, and bless heaven.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Thou speakest wonders.

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: She shall be, to the happiness of England,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: An aged princess; many days shall see her,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: And yet no day without a deed to crown it.

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: Would I had known no more! but she must die,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: She must, the saints must have her; yet a virgin,

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: A most unspotted lily shall she pass

speaker: CRANMER
text_entry: To the ground, and all the world shall mourn her.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: O lord archbishop,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Thou hast made me now a man! never, before

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: This happy child, did I get any thing:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: This oracle of comfort has so pleased me,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: That when I am in heaven I shall desire

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: To see what this child does, and praise my Maker.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I thank ye all. To you, my good lord mayor,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And your good brethren, I am much beholding;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I have received much honour by your presence,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And ye shall find me thankful. Lead the way, lords:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Ye must all see the queen, and she must thank ye,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: She will be sick else. This day, no man think

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Has business at his house; for all shall stay:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: This little one shall make it holiday.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: EPILOGUE

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: 'Tis ten to one this play can never please

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: All that are here: some come to take their ease,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And sleep an act or two; but those, we fear,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: We have frighted with our trumpets; so, 'tis clear,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: They'll say 'tis naught: others, to hear the city

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Abused extremely, and to cry 'That's witty!'

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Which we have not done neither: that, I fear,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: All the expected good we're like to hear

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: For this play at this time, is only in

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The merciful construction of good women;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: For such a one we show'd 'em: if they smile,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And say 'twill do, I know, within a while

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: All the best men are ours; for 'tis ill hap,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: If they hold when their ladies bid 'em clap.
